definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: All users should refrain from damaging the driving range, its fixture and equipment.
sentences.chinese: 严禁破坏高尔夫球发球练习场及其设备器材。

sentences.english: But in training Duff limps out early.
sentences.chinese: 可是练习场上，达夫早早地跛着退出了。

sentences.english: Per stay will gain 2 complimentary golf tickets.
sentences.chinese: 每房赠送2张免费高尔夫专业练习场体验券。

sentences.english: No. It has a driving range at the Moon Lake Park.
sentences.chinese: 没有，只有在净月潭公园有一个高尔夫球练习场。

sentences.english: Tseung Kwan O new driving range construction is progressing, expected to be completed in this Autumn.
sentences.chinese: 将军澳练习场工程进展顺利，预计本年秋季竣工。

sentences.english: We're here at the OCT Driving Range today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们在华侨城高尔夫练习场。

sentences.english: Ok. On the driving range, you can hit one ball every 10 second.
sentences.chinese: 在练习场，你却能每10秒钟就打一个球。

sentences.english: The golfer went to the driving range to practice his pivot.
sentences.chinese: 那个高尔夫球手去练习场练习他的转身动作。

sentences.english: And we are here at the beautiful OCT Golf Driving Range.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们在环境优美的华侨城高尔夫练习场。

definition: table tennis/table tennis ball (Tw)/billiards/pool/snooker (HK, Singapore, Malaysia)
skating or ice rink/ice stadium/ice arena
club (golf)/cue (billiards)/also written 球桿|球杆[qiu2 gan1]
